column4: after update throuth ubuntu srclist, my Sarge is monster now:(
It's possible that i turn my debiuntu back to ubuntu base system?
you can force versions on everything but.. yuck
hmm... in synaptic you could remove all repositories but the ubuntu ones...
then filter the installed list for local or obsolete packages and then force their versions to the ubuntu ones
i used only ubuntu repositories when i update
good, well it's just a cause of switching versions... or have I not understood your situation correctly?
yep. i used pure debian before
so you started with debian and then upgraded to ubuntu? (hoary?)
yep. Sarge updated to hoary. I thinked the pure unbuntu is too huge for me
if you know that much then you should be able to figure out your own mess :)
but i suppose i don't :(   i think there must be a way to return to base system,but i have never tried it before
just remove all the packages you've installed
no problem, I just popped in because I hadn't used IRC in ages and found nice client to try - I should really get back to work ;)
